definition: to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Today is just not my day.
sentences.chinese: 我今天真是倒楣到极点。

sentences.english: He put off the evil hour.
sentences.chinese: 他把这个倒楣的时刻推迟下去。

sentences.english: If you carry on like this you'll come in for it sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 你如果老是这样下去，早晚要倒楣的。

sentences.english: Has you to accompany in the side, is as if not that bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 有袮在身边陪伴，似乎也不褆那么倒楣。

sentences.english: We need to know what a real bill looks like.
sentences.chinese: 我今天感觉糟透了，你碰上我算你倒楣。

sentences.english: Lucky Fellow and Unlucky Guy are neighbors and have been on good terms with each other.
sentences.chinese: 幸运儿和倒楣蛋是住在对门儿的好朋友。

sentences.english: Listen to a joke at one's own expense.
sentences.chinese: 听一个含有自认倒楣，自我牺牲的笑话。

sentences.english: The Commandant has had a rotten day.
sentences.chinese: 司令官这一天过得真倒楣。

sentences.english: He said the continuing circumstances were unfortunate.
sentences.chinese: 他说那种持续性的情况真的很倒楣。

definition: see 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
(dialect) hen/prostitute/(Tw) interfering/nosy/busybody (from Taiwanese 家婆, Tai-lo pr. [ke-pô])
household dish, implement or furniture/domestic animal/(coll.) guy/chap/weapon
to be born under an ill star
